title: The BEST Garlic Shrimp

description: Indulge in the rich, garlicky flavors of this Hawaiian-inspired garlic shrimp dish. Perfectly cooked shrimp in a buttery sauce will transport you to the sunny shores of Hawaii with every bite.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.
Add shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes per side until pink.
Stir in butter and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.
tips: For the best flavor, use fresh garlic and don't overcook the shrimp to keep them tender.

structured_content.content: This garlic shrimp recipe is a true delight, capturing the essence of Hawaiian street food. The succulent shrimp are enveloped in a rich, buttery garlic sauce that is simply irresistible, making it a perfect dish for any seafood lover.

structured_content.content: I remember the first time I had garlic shrimp from a food truck in Hawaii; the flavors were unforgettable. This recipe brings that same joy to my kitchen, reminding me of sunny days by the beach.

• Main ingredient: Fresh shrimp are best for this dish; look for ones that are firm and have a mild scent.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Garlic is essential for that rich flavor; use fresh minced garlic for the best results.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter adds richness, while parsley provides a fresh contrast.
  • Equipment needed: A large skillet is essential for even cooking.

upload.context: A vibrant display of fresh shrimp and ingredients ready for preparation.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Peel and devein the shrimp, and mince the garlic. Gather all ingredients before starting.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Heat oil, sauté garlic, add shrimp, and cook until pink. Stir in butter and season.
Finishing Touches:
Garnish with parsley and serve immediately for the best flavor.

upload.context: Capturing the sizzling shrimp in the skillet as they cook to perfection.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Cook shrimp just until pink to avoid toughness.
  • Avoid burning the garlic, as it can turn bitter.
  • Visual cue: shrimp should be opaque and curled when done.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 2 days.

structured_content.content: This dish is a favorite in my family, often served during gatherings. Sharing it with loved ones brings back memories of laughter and good times.
For an extra kick, add a pinch of red pepper flakes or a splash of lemon juice to brighten the dish.
Serve with steamed rice or crusty bread to soak up the delicious sauce. Pair with a chilled white wine for a delightful meal.
For a gluten-free version, ensure all ingredients are certified gluten-free. You can also substitute shrimp with chicken or tofu for a different twist.

upload.context: A beautifully plated dish of garlic shrimp, garnished and ready to enjoy.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use high-quality butter for a richer flavor.
  • Prep garlic ahead of time to streamline cooking.
  • Timing is key; have everything ready to go before you start cooking.
  • Plate beautifully for an impressive presentation.

structured_content.content: Don’t hesitate to try this recipe; it’s simple yet incredibly satisfying. You’ll feel proud serving this flavorful dish to your family and friends!
